sub_title: I write stories and help other creatives and entrepreneurs write their story and shape their ventures.
summary:
Story is at the heart of everything I do. 

I recently rediscovered recordings of stories I made when I was a seven year old. It was all there: the setting, the characters, the arc and dilemma. The style was rough around the edges, but not bad for what you’d expect of a kid. I like to think I’ve polished somewhat in the years since. I never stopped crafting stories either for myself or for the people I work with, be they clients, collaborators, or those I love. I help others with their stories and ventures-- the authentic core they want to give to the world, their contribution that merits the world’s attention. 

Those old tapes held recordings of songwriting and fiction, and those old loves have held fast and true. Today, my writing and work also explores themes inspired by my multi-decade study into human relationships, creative processes, and entrepreneurship.

profile_positions.description: Whether working on a piece of writing or building a new venture, bringing new things into the world is a wholistic challenge. My purpose is to tend the creative fire.
profile_positions.title: Crafts Stories

profile_positions.description: Hampikian Ventures is a venture building studio that enables founding teams to grow thriving companies through healthy founder relationships. The studio allows for the most effective allocation of human and financial capital by preempting an important decelerator/ bottleneck & value destroyer of startups: unhealthy founder relationships.
profile_positions.title: Builds Ventures

company.name: Idaho Coalition Against Sexual & Domestic Violence

profile_positions.company: Idaho Coalition Against Sexual & Domestic Violence
profile_positions.description:
In this role I brought my ability to shape relatable narratives and put it in the service of the important cause of healthy relationships. 

Public Speaking highlights:
Lobbied Congress for funds preventing teen dating violence at the U.S. Capitol (2011)
Keynote speaker at the National Foundation for Women’s Legislators, Des Moines, Iowa (2011)
Keynote speaker for Idaho Senator Mike Crapo’s SAFE Teen Act Conference, Idaho State Capitol (2011)
University of Idaho Speakers Bureau member for interpersonal violence prevention (2013)

Media Coverage Highlights:
Quoted in the New York Times: “A Warning to Teenagers Before They Start Dating” by Jan Hoffman (June 2012)
Interview with ABC’s “Nightline” (July 2012)
Appearance on “The Oprah Winfrey Show” (March 2009)
Interviews with local news KIVI 6 (Sep. 2009), KBOI 2 (Oct. 2009), and KTVB (Jan. 2010)
Quoted in The Daily Beast: “Teaching Teens to Have Healthy Breakups” by Liz Kulze (July 2012)
Youth leader of Movement 143: a teen-led initiative to end teen dating violence in Idaho
Youth leader for a two-day conference for 50 teen activists across the state of Idaho
Drafting press releases, event coordination, and database organization
Interviewing, hiring, and creation of on-boarding toolkit / training the next set of young adult activists
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I told the story of the Discovery Center, thus allowing stakeholders and sponsors to relate to and contribute to the success of this science communication institution. 

Led a team responsible for growing contributed income by approximately 25% from FY 16 to FY 17, including all income from corporate sponsorships, grants, foundations, and major donors, accounting for approximately 1/3 of the annual operating budget

Secured funding to produce four Boise-made, hands-on science exhibitions including “Matter Splatter,” “H2Whoa!” and “ZAP! The Current Exhibition,” as well as additional funding for 2018’s feature exhibition, and secured funding to bring two blockbuster traveling exhibitions to Idaho including “A T.Rex Named Sue” and “Planet Shark”

Created strong interdepartmental relationships with operations, education, exhibits, and finance to create cohesive budgets, proposals, and reports

Forged strong relationships with corporations, small businesses, foundations, educational partners, and community leaders to lay the preliminary groundwork for a $15-20 million capital campaign

Successfully led the Discovery Center’s largest fundraiser, its annual gala, “Science with Style,” by growing its attendance by 30%, and its success as a fundraiser by 20%

Created a monthly giving program, “Nerd Herd” to provide a sustainable private giving model to the Center
profile_positions.title: Development Director

profile_positions.description:
I founded TEDxBoise so the stories of worthy and inspiring humans could be spread far and wide, in Idaho and beyond. In the process I deepened my skills in the production of film and live performance. 

Created Boise’s first successful TEDxBoise event and professional quality broadcast, including over 30 published videos on Youtube, and collecting over eight million views online

Led a team of rockstar volunteers and contractors to cohesively organize the events bringing in skills from finance, accounting, marketing, design, speaker coaching, film and stage production, fundraising, set design, and logistics

Managed the budget for all related events and workshops, securing funding resources for financial gaps

Sustainably grew our event budget by 300% from TEDxBoise 2015 to TEDxBoise 2016, increasing our in-person attendees by 450%, and increasing our community engagement and outreach, and successfully passed off TEDxBoise in 2017 to my volunteer team, creating a sustainable future for TEDxBoise

As of June 2017, TEDxBoise has produced seven major events including two TEDxBoise’s, a TEDxBoiseWomen, and three TEDx workshops.
profile_positions.title: Executive Producer and Primary License Holder

profile_positions.description:
Executed financial management with Quickbooks and Salesforce including receivable and payable accounts, reviewed credit card statements, and prepared budget reports

Planned and executed effective outreach events for the general public and prospective donors

Managed communication to current and prospective donors through website maintenance, eblasts, social media, and print media

Coordinated volunteer outreach, organization and communications

Negotiated business contracts for human resource benefits, office overhead, and operations
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
In this role I shaped the authentic stories that my clients had to give to the world. 

Worked as an independent brand consultant offering online marketing strategy including strategic social media messaging, website design, and branding strategy

Worked as Director of New Business Development with high profile relationship expert, Dr. Wendy Walsh

Produced a weekly Google Hangout show connecting experts on relationships, psychology, and related topics

Developed business proposals, plans, and presentations for new business ventures, products, and partnerships

Offered brand management for online platforms and led interning staff in social media marketing on Facebook, Twitter, Hootsuite, WordPress, and Google including Google+, YouTube, Helpouts, and Hangouts

Worked closely with web developers to improve bounce rates, visitor engagement, and SEO optimization

Represented clients at national conferences, meetings, and teleconferences

Assisted executives in scheduling, technical support, communications management, and authorship
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant
